7F944D62B74C4C168FACBD8A43956D30.description:
Prints letters of own name with letter approximations and some actual
letters using a stable three-finger grasp.

724001BF2D6B4579A3C163504537F29F.description:
Copies letters of own name and other meaningful words with letter
approximations and some actual letters using a stable three-finger grasp.

C3E52F77CFC946AA908D7CAA5B3AC787.description: Imitates drawing prewriting strokes (|, −, +, O) using an inconsistent threeor four-finger grasp of dominant hand to hold a writing tool.

FB95113DDEF9443C9E9DA72A31115812.description:
Scribbles and draws using thumb and fingers (five-finger grasp) of one
hand to hold writing tool.

A7E8B4E56B4748D5A0483486B3159434.description:
Makes marks and scribbles using a fist to hold writing tool against the
palm of the hand (palmar grasp).

1FE449715B0A4C1489479584B4D41FFD.description: Holds object with one hand while the other manipulates the object.

A42E4CE547614BCBB5E16934598E3A08.description: Transfers objects from one hand to the other.

02BA81F3B536492BB0C1A51262F1D2C8.description: Draws and writes using increasingly sophisticated grasp.

4582CEA48F8A4B13AEF7442CF041A8C5.description:
Uses a combination of drawing, dictating, and emergent writing for a
variety of purposes.

6B9096C0818946AFB90F345280D232D4.description: Recognizes that print conveys a message.

AE433C6828CC47358BC5CA13EB8615AA.description: Notices familiar environmental signs and symbols.

258B72FAD840451FA2A60FF85EAB1B6D.description: Tracks objects visually and focuses on an object or person.9

4732609C8B784AFE99F7E798FEB6F79B.description: Develops understanding that writing represents spoken language.

2BD8D71B48E44C3283E1A4AF1D998363.description: Identifies and names 18 uppercase and 15 lowercase letters.

939B482B3D6A4C18B89BB197D0AC12F0.description: Demonstrates understanding that letters can be uppercase and lowercase.

E6C99477D48A4895BA87BA0F018A0EC6.description: Recognizes some letters and their sounds in addition to those in first name.

A857306336B2466288FC9433ABCBEF55.description:
Recognizes first letter and sound of own name and names a few letters in
own name.

495FD78B78654406B673EECE4EDE81DD.description: Says the names of some letters by rote (without print).

3C3653972926404DA932E20D77A47C40.description: Notices when adult points to print.

91EEC2D8DA4F4E2AAB45E5075C6C45C4.description:
Demonstrates understanding of book and print organization in nonfiction
and fiction books.

50874C12930A4D0AA1520AD580B6B1A0.description: Knows some characteristics of books, such as cover, author and illustrator.

CBCCFA0830E14B4EABA223EEB8A6BD99.description:
Orients books correctly and turns pages when “reading” from beginning to
end.

780A5C1C39154A858E2ABD2A28288DC6.description:
Shows an understanding of book covers by self-selecting books to explore
independently.

5CCA94D49AF14CB890BC5E85DB6B112B.description: Selects books for adult to read.

C19C193E23E444268C7085A131B48211.description: Distinguishes between sounds that are the same and different.

1BB2555EFD0F4C9A88E849116CC69761.description: Engages in back-and-forth interactions with caregiver.

98CF0CDFD96C4F8E9A1D64BDF8780913.description: Blends and segments onset and rime in a single-syllable spoken word.

023F5132080E4513974CD3B6EBD995D2.description: Isolates the initial sound in a spoken word.

AFCF8C5A927C42F7AC054C389AD88D46.description: Recognizes when the beginning sounds of words are the same or different.

F6923C08F2FE4328AAEE2E58E3CCA41D.description: Uses spoken words with meaning in phrases.

4C643907E4F64428ACF6C0252B23EC5B.description: Engages in back-and-forth interactions with caregiver.

21FD36AB06EF4F41828AC5E6ED545607.description: Develops awareness of initial sounds, onsets, and rimes in spoken words.

F2A30F61C50F45B19D29A31C39D565A8.description: Blends and segments syllables in spoken words.

3352AA78F7A041AB83124081532BE55B.description: Blends and segments spoken compound words.

C9B941868AE24CCAAEB4E87D1F81C835.description: Recognizes individual words that make up a spoken sentence.

789523936A75431485ED445434756892.description: Uses spoken words with meaning in phrases.

448A8618CA1A4ADAAB3AAC2AA09609CF.description: Engages in back-and-forth interactions with caregiver.

2296098A0E59420F93F925D392C4FA68.description: Develops awareness of syllables in spoken words.

11DB40D33E8D40FC85436704B83391BC.description:
Demonstrates understanding of a read-aloud text by answering inferential
questions.

0AD5353B6B034BEBA074021C16846773.description:
Demonstrates understanding of a read-aloud text by answering literal
questions.

702C695207FF4A6D919E8226E026BA68.description: Participates in book reading, storytelling, and singing.

4DEE22683F6046B2B38FDA0B4D181AAD.description: Shows interest in books, pictures, songs, and rhymes.

98DDFAAB379340679C673DAAB7374555.description:
Follows typical patterns when communicating with others (e.g., listens
to others, takes turns talking and speaking about the topic or text being
discussed).

576CE6E8CA0A412EA734A98C40AC5856.description:
Participates in and initiates communication by switching communication
skills to fit the need of the audience.

C3F762CAADE74399B8D4EA87F3EB4AAE.description:
Participates in and initiates basic communications with family members or
others who are familiar.

9408859BC6D24D069B29E0BBD9CD0D18.description: Engages in back-and-forth interactions with caregiver.

8136C891BA59471C9734C33CD05B5337.description: Participates in conversations with increasing application of turn-taking skills.

F628C8305E084A60B734481BC3D88594.description:
Communicates using sentences that include the following components:
subject, verb, object, descriptive words, and prepositions.

98E05854CB1E4BF4837C4672B9EC3598.description:
Communicates using simple three- and four-word phrases or sentences to
express complex ideas or requests.

37576083311043ACBF481502E1BF7877.description: Combines words into simple two-word phrases.

047948F20C0643868D4B7012058F2D46.description: Communicates purposefully using single words and gestures.

0D42D56C5CF8420F8EB770E40DB8ECD1.description: Engages in back-and-forth interactions with caregiver.

1F8DAFD96C46461086C51A50AAEE6326.description: Expresses needs and feelings in a variety of ways.

E09A299B7F53421689E8885EF04B4945.description:
Demonstrates understanding of categories of words (nouns, verbs,
adjectives, pronouns, prepositions) and relationships between word
meanings.

B901B2F877164928B3FB19A7AB37F385.description: Demonstrates interest in new vocabulary and uses new words.

7574596AADD0436DAA50C6A1E3DE3728.description: Engages in back-and-forth interactions with caregiver.

9A8A71B2858845E5B6F9786380862928.description: Develops and expands understanding of vocabulary and concepts.

AC654210CCBE4EABA92598F408DB0157.description: Demonstrates understanding of complex concepts and longer sentences.

AF87547148F84D8B923656ACE29D16C0.description:
Shows understanding of requests and statements referring to people,
objects, ideas, and feelings.

28A8A44EF2614C239F1721051DFF8DF9.description:
Shows understanding of simple requests and statements referring to
nearby people and objects.

7CFB589B65464714A31CC082FFCDCFF2.description: Engages in back-and-forth interactions with caregiver.

B92EDD523A1C4541A1C3EA90CEFEA012.description: Demonstrates understanding of increasingly complex language.
